00020 /*! 
00021 
00022 \page txt2echp_description Writing expression results to a "quantification" CHP file.
00023 
00024 This program is provided as an example of using the Fusion SDK to write expression results to an Affymetrix
00025 "quantification" CHP file. The quantification CHP file was designed to store a set of quantification values
00026 with their associated probe set names. The Expression Console software currently uses the "quantification" CHP
00027 file for storing results from the RMA and PLIER algorithms.
00028 
00029 The program is implemented as a command line application. The arguments specify items such as the TSV file
00030 containing the expression results, algorithm parameters, summary statistics, probe array type, parent CEL file, 
00031 and other items that are stored in the CHP file header.
00032 
00033  */
00034 
00035 #include "calvin_files/converters/utils/src/CmdLine.h"
00036 #include "calvin_files/fusion/src/FusionCELData.h"
00037 #include "calvin_files/parsers/src/GenericFileReader.h"
00038 #include "calvin_files/utils/src/FileUtils.h"
00039 #include "calvin_files/utils/src/StringUtils.h"
00040 #include "calvin_files/writers/src/CalvinCHPQuantificationFileBufferWriter.h"
00041 #include "calvin_files/writers/src/CalvinCHPQuantificationFileWriter.h"
00042 #include "calvin_files/writers/src/GenericDataHeaderUpdater.h"
00043 //
00044 #include <fstream>
00045 #include <iostream>
00046 #include <list>
00047 #include <vector>
00048 //
00049 
00050 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00051 #pragma warning(disable: 4996)
00052 #endif
00053 
00054 using namespace std;
00055 using namespace affymetrix_calvin_io;
00056 using namespace affymetrix_calvin_data;
00057 using namespace affymetrix_fusion_io;
00058 using namespace affymetrix_calvin_utilities;
00059 
00060 /*! Create a "quantification" CHP file with just the header information. The remainder of the file
00061  * will be created at a later time using the buffer writer technique.
00062  * The CHP file will contain only "quantification" results from an expression analysis.
00063  * @param execId The execution identifier. This identifier is used to identify the batch run that created the CHP files.
00064  * @param celFile The full path to the parent CEL file. The header of the CEL file is copied to the CHP file.
00065  * @param outFile The name of the output CHP file.
00066  * @param probeSetNames The probe set names.
00067  * @param algName The name of the algorithm used to create the results.
00068  * @param algVersion The algorithm version.
00069  * @param chipType the chip type, also known as the probe array type.
00070  * @param programName The name of the program used to create the CHP file.
00071  * @param programVersion The version of the program.
00072  * @param programCompany The company or institution who developed the CHP creating software.
00073  * @param paramNames A list of parameter names to store in the CHP file header.
00074  * @param paramValues A list of parameter values to store in the CHP file header.
00075  * @param sumNames A list of summary statistic names to store in the CHP file header.
00076  * @param sumValues A list of summary statistic values to store in the CHP file header.
00077 */
00078 static void CreateFileWithHeader
00079 (
00080         const string &execId,
00081         const string &celFile,
00082         const string &outFile,
00083         const list<string> &probeSetNames,
00084         const string &algName,
00085         const string &algVersion,
00086         const string &chipType,
00087         const string &programName,
00088         const string &programVersion,
00089         const string &programCompany,
00090         const vector<string>& paramNames,
00091         const vector<string>& paramValues,
00092         const vector<string>& sumNames,
00093         const vector<string>& sumValues
00094 )
00095 {
00096         // Determine the max probe set name.
00097         int numEntries = (int) probeSetNames.size();
00098         int maxProbeSetNameLength = 0;
00099         for (list<string>::const_iterator it=probeSetNames.begin(); it!=probeSetNames.end(); it++)
00100         {
00101                 maxProbeSetNameLength = max(maxProbeSetNameLength, (int) it->length());
00102         }
00103 
00104         // Create the data object
00105         CHPQuantificationData *data = new CHPQuantificationData(outFile);
00106     data->SetEntryCount(numEntries, maxProbeSetNameLength);
00107         data->SetAlgName(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS(algName));
00108         data->SetAlgVersion(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS(algVersion));
00109         data->SetArrayType(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS(chipType));
00110 
00111         // Store the CEL header
00112         if (celFile.length() > 0 && FileUtils::Exists(celFile.c_str()) == true)
00113         {
00114                 FusionCELData cel;
00115                 cel.SetFileName(celFile.c_str());
00116         cel.ReadHeader();
00117             GenericData *gdata = cel.GetGenericData();
00118             if (gdata != NULL)
00119                         data->GetFileHeader()->GetGenericDataHdr()->AddParent(*gdata->Header().GetGenericDataHdr()); 
00120             cel.Close();
00121         }
00122 
00123         // Add algorithm parameters to list.
00124     ParameterNameValueTypeList params;
00125     ParameterNameValueType param;
00126     
00127         if (programName.empty() == false)
00128         {
00129                 param.SetName(L"program-name");
00130                 param.SetValueText(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS(programName));
00131                 data->GetGenericData().Header().GetGenericDataHdr()->AddNameValParam(param);
00132         }
00133 
00134         if (programVersion.empty() == false)
00135         {
00136                 param.SetName(L"program-version");
00137                 param.SetValueText(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS(programVersion));
00138                 data->GetGenericData().Header().GetGenericDataHdr()->AddNameValParam(param);
00139         }
00140 
00141         if (programCompany.empty() == false)
00142         {
00143                 param.SetName(L"program-company");
00144                 param.SetValueText(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS(programCompany));
00145                 data->GetGenericData().Header().GetGenericDataHdr()->AddNameValParam(param);
00146         }
00147 
00148         int nparams = (int) paramNames.size();
00149         param.SetName(L"exec-guid");
00150         param.SetValueAscii(execId);
00151         params.push_back(param);
00152         for(int iparam=0; iparam<nparams; iparam++)
00153         {
00154                 param.SetName(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS(paramNames[iparam]));
00155         param.SetValueAscii(paramValues[iparam]);
00156         params.push_back(param);
00157         }
00158         if (params.empty() == false)
00159                 data->AddAlgParams(params);
00160 
00161         params.clear();
00162         nparams = (int) sumNames.size();
00163         for(int iparam=0; iparam<nparams; iparam++)
00164         {
00165                 param.SetName(StringUtils::ConvertMBSToWCS(sumNames[iparam]));
00166         param.SetValueAscii(sumValues[iparam]);
00167         params.push_back(param);
00168         }
00169         if (params.empty() == false)
00170                 data->AddSummaryParams(params);
00171 
00172         // Creating the writer object will create the file with the header information.
00173         CHPQuantificationFileWriter writer(*data);
00174 
00175         // Write the probe set names.
00176         writer.SeekToDataSet();
00177         ProbeSetQuantificationData entry;
00178         for (list<string>::const_iterator it=probeSetNames.begin(); it!=probeSetNames.end(); it++)
00179         {
00180         entry.name = *it;
00181         entry.quantification = 0.0f;
00182         writer.WriteEntry(entry);
00183     }
00184 }
00185 
00186 /*! Adds the expression (quantification) results to the CHP file. This function uses the buffer writer object
00187  * to write the data to the CHP file.
00188  * @param outFile The name of the output CHP file.
00189  * @param data The quantification (signal) results.
00190  */
00191 static void UpdateQuantifications(const string &outFile, const list<float> &data)
00192 {
00193         // Create the buffer writer object
00194         CHPQuantificationFileBufferWriter expressionQuantificationBufferWriter;
00195         vector<string> fileNames;
00196         fileNames.push_back(outFile);
00197         expressionQuantificationBufferWriter.Initialize(&fileNames);
00198 
00199         // Write the data
00200         for (list<float>::const_iterator it=data.begin(); it!=data.end(); it++)
00201         {
00202                 expressionQuantificationBufferWriter.WriteQuantificationEntry(0, *it);
00203         }
00204 
00205         // Flush the buffer. The destructor will close the file.
00206         expressionQuantificationBufferWriter.FlushBuffer();
00207 }
00208 
00209 /*! Parse a line into a list.
00210  * @param line The line of data
00211  * @return A vector of strings from the line (separated by tabs).
00212  */
00213 static vector<string> ParseLine(char *line)
00214 {
00215         vector<string> tokens;
00216         const char *sep = "\t";
00217         char *token = strtok(line, sep);
00218         while (token != NULL)
00219         {
00220                 tokens.push_back(token);
00221                 token = strtok(NULL, sep);
00222         }
00223         return tokens;  
00224 }
00225 
00226 /*! Reads the expression results from a simple TSV text file.
00227  * @param inFile The name of the input TSV file.
00228  * @param names The probe set names from the input file.
00229  * @param quantifications The quantification values from the input file.
00230  */
00231 static void ReadData(const string &inFile, list<string> &names, list<float> &quantifications)
00232 {
00233         // Open the file
00234         ifstream instr(inFile.c_str(), ios::in);
00235         if (!instr)
00236                 throw string("Unable to read the input file");
00237 
00238         // First line with header
00239         char line[1024];
00240         instr.getline(line, 1024);
00241 
00242         // Get the data
00243         names.clear();
00244         quantifications.clear();
00245         while (instr.getline(line, 1024))
00246         {
00247                 vector<string> cols = ParseLine(line);
00248                 names.push_back(cols[0]);
00249                 quantifications.push_back((float)atof(cols[1].c_str()));
00250         }
00251 }
00252 
00253 /*! Show a help message on the use of the command line parameters. */
00254 static void show_help()
00255 {
00256         const char *tab = "\t";
00257         cout << "The command line arguments include" << endl;
00258         cout << tab << "-execid <the execution id>" << endl;
00259         cout << tab << "-cel <the name of the parent cel file>" << endl;
00260         cout << tab << "-in <the name of the input data file, TSV with 1 header row>" << endl;
00261         cout << tab << "-out <the name of the output CHP file>" << endl;
00262         cout << tab << "-arrayType <the probe array type>" << endl;
00263         cout << tab << "-algName <the algorithm name>" << endl;
00264         cout << tab << "-algVersion <the algorithm version>" << endl;
00265         cout << tab << "-programName <the program name>" << endl;
00266         cout << tab << "-programVersion <the program version>" << endl;
00267         cout << tab << "-programCompany <the name of the company>" << endl;
00268         cout << tab << "-paramNames <a list of parameter names>" << endl;
00269         cout << tab << "-paramValues <a list of parameter values>" << endl;
00270         cout << tab << "-sumNames <a list of summary parameter names>" << endl;
00271         cout << tab << "-sumValues <a list of summary parameter values>" << endl;
00272         cout << endl;
00273         cout << "The input file must have the probe set name and quantification values" << endl <<
00274                         "as the first two columns. The paramNames and paramValues arguments are" << endl <<
00275                         "used to specify algorithm parameter." << endl;
00276 }
00277 
00278 /*! The main entrance to the program. */
00279 int main(int argc, char * argv[])
00280 {
00281         try
00282         {
00283                 // Parse the command line arguments.
00284                 CCmdLine cmdLine;
00285                 if (cmdLine.SplitLine(argc, argv) < 1)
00286                 {
00287                         show_help();
00288                         exit(-1);
00289                 }
00290 
00291                 string execId = cmdLine.GetArgument("-execid", 0);
00292                 string celFile = cmdLine.GetSafeArgument("-cel", 0, "");
00293                 string inFile = cmdLine.GetArgument("-in", 0);
00294                 string outFile = cmdLine.GetArgument("-out", 0);
00295                 string arrayType = cmdLine.GetArgument("-arrayType", 0);
00296                 string algName = cmdLine.GetArgument("-algName", 0);
00297                 string algVersion = cmdLine.GetArgument("-algVersion", 0);
00298                 string programName = cmdLine.GetArgument("-programName", 0);
00299                 string programVersion = cmdLine.GetArgument("-programVersion", 0);
00300                 string programCompany = cmdLine.GetArgument("-programCompany", 0);
00301 
00302                 vector<string> paramNames;
00303                 int n = cmdLine.GetArgumentCount("-paramNames");
00304                 for (int i=0; i<n; i++)
00305                         paramNames.push_back(cmdLine.GetArgument("-paramNames", i));
00306 
00307                 vector<string> paramValues;
00308                 n = cmdLine.GetArgumentCount("-paramValues");
00309                 for (int i=0; i<n; i++)
00310                         paramValues.push_back(cmdLine.GetArgument("-paramValues", i));
00311 
00312                 vector<string> sumNames;
00313                 n = cmdLine.GetArgumentCount("-sumNames");
00314                 for (int i=0; i<n; i++)
00315                         sumNames.push_back(cmdLine.GetArgument("-sumNames", i));
00316 
00317                 vector<string> sumValues;
00318                 n = cmdLine.GetArgumentCount("-sumValues");
00319                 for (int i=0; i<n; i++)
00320                         sumValues.push_back(cmdLine.GetArgument("-sumValues", i));
00321 
00322                 // Read the TSV input file
00323                 list<string> names;
00324                 list<float> quantifications;
00325                 ReadData(inFile, names, quantifications);
00326 
00327                 // Create the CHP file.
00328                 CreateFileWithHeader(execId, celFile, outFile, names, algName, algVersion, arrayType,
00329                         programName, programVersion, programCompany, paramNames, paramValues, sumNames, sumValues);
00330                 UpdateQuantifications(outFile, quantifications);
00331         }
00332         catch (string s)
00333         {
00334                 cout << s << endl;
00335                 show_help();
00336         }
00337         catch (int e)
00338         {
00339                 cout << "Invalid argument" << endl;
00340                 show_help();
00341         }
00342         catch (...)
00343         {
00344                 cout << "Unknown error" << endl;
00345                 show_help();
00346         }
00347         return 0;
00348 }
